title: How to Clean Makeup Brushes with Witch Hazel

steps.headline: Gather all your brushes in a clean, convenient area.
steps.description: Places such as the living room floor or the kitchen counter usually aren't acceptable if you live with others or have pets. If your bathroom is clean, putting them on the counter is a good idea, so long as you avoid chemicals or other things such as makeup and water.

steps.headline: Wet your brushes with tap water, or if you have it handy, distilled water.
steps.description: Get as much makeup as you can out of the brush before you apply the witch hazel.

steps.headline: Prepare the witch hazel.
steps.description: A good technique is to mix water and witch hazel in a spray bottle. Try to make it 3 parts water and one or two parts witch hazel.♥

steps.headline: Squeeze the water from your preliminary washing out of your brush.
steps.description: Spray the brush with the bottle, and don't be heavy handed. Use your fingers to work it into the centre of the brush, or spread open the brushes and clear out the inside.

steps.headline: Leave the brushes for fifteen minutes.
steps.description: Do not soak them in the witch hazel.

steps.headline: After fifteen minutes, take the brushes and rinse them off again in tap/distilled water.
steps.description: Make sure to get in all the crevices and bristles.

steps.headline: If this did not do the job, repeat the process.
Once your brushes are completely clean, or clean enough to your liking, lay them out on a piece of toilet or tissue paper overnight to dry.
steps.description: Try to fluff up the bristles every few minutes while they are still wet.

steps.headline: Congrats!
steps.description: You have nice clean brushes! It's like you just bought them.

text: Gather all your brushes in a clean, convenient area. Places such as the living room floor or the kitchen counter usually aren't acceptable if you live with others or have pets. If your bathroom is clean, putting them on the counter is a good idea, so long as you avoid chemicals or other things such as makeup and water. Wet your brushes with tap water, or if you have it handy, distilled water. Get as much makeup as you can out of the brush before you apply the witch hazel. Prepare the witch hazel. A good technique is to mix water and witch hazel in a spray bottle. Try to make it 3 parts water and one or two parts witch hazel.♥ Squeeze the water from your preliminary washing out of your brush. Spray the brush with the bottle, and don't be heavy handed. Use your fingers to work it into the centre of the brush, or spread open the brushes and clear out the inside. Leave the brushes for fifteen minutes. Do not soak them in the witch hazel. After fifteen minutes, take the brushes and rinse them off again in tap/distilled water. Make sure to get in all the crevices and bristles. If this did not do the job, repeat the process.  Once your brushes are completely clean, or clean enough to your liking, lay them out on a piece of toilet or tissue paper overnight to dry. Try to fluff up the bristles every few minutes while they are still wet. Congrats! You have nice clean brushes! It's like you just bought them.
